block.p: Dr. Sajani Shah, a general surgeon, and Dr. Sameer Kapasi, an intern, are to be married today. Pandit Rambhai Thaker, a Hindu priest, is to officiate in a ceremony at the Hyatt Regency in Hauppauge, N.Y.

Dr. Shah-Kapasi, 32, is to begin a fellowship in minimally invasive surgery next month at the Tufts University New England Medical Center in Boston; she completed a residency in general surgery in May at the State University of New York Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn. She graduated from the State University at Albany and received her medical degree from St. George's University in Grenada. She is a daughter of Kamini and Narendra N. Shah of Roslyn Heights.

The bride's father, a pharmacist, works for CVS stores in Nassau County. Her mother is a United States Postal Service clerk at the Broadway Station in Long Island City, Queens.

The bridegroom, 30, is to begin a residency next month in physical medicine and rehabilitation, also at the New England Medical Center; he will complete his internship at Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn this week. He graduated from Johns Hopkins and also received his medical degree from St. George's, although the couple did not meet there.
He is the son of Dr. Chander M. Kapasi and Dr. Onaly A. Kapasi of Newton Centre, Mass. The bridegroom's mother is a gynecologist and his father is an orthopedic surgeon. They are in private practice.
